block.p: Sarah Midori Zimmerman, a daughter of Michi Itami of New York and Dr. Michael P. Zimmerman of Richmond, Calif., was married in New York yesterday to William Bruce Vanderhoof, a son of Audrey and William H. Vanderhoof of Fort Worth. The Rev. Erik Kolbell performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia.

Ms. Zimmerman, 39, is keeping her name. She is a senior writer of speeches and business proposals at Rubenstein Communications, a public relations firm in New York. She graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in English from New York University. Her father is a professor of English at San Francisco State University and is a psychoanalyst with a private practice in Berkeley, Calif. Her mother is an artist and a professor of art at the City College of New York.

Sarah Midori Zimmerman, a daughter of Michi Itami of New York and Dr. Michael P. Zimmerman of Richmond, Calif., was married in New York yesterday to William Bruce Vanderhoof, a son of Audrey and William H. Vanderhoof of Fort Worth. The Rev. Erik Kolbell performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia.

Ms. Zimmerman, 39, is keeping her name. She is a senior writer of speeches and business proposals at Rubenstein Communications, a public relations firm in New York. She graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in English from New York University. Her father is a professor of English at San Francisco State University and is a psychoanalyst with a private practice in Berkeley, Calif. Her mother is an artist and a professor of art at the City College of New York.

Mr. Vanderhoof, 40, is a consultant in New York for companies in the energy field. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother, who is retired, was a librarian at Texas Christian University in Fort Worth, where his father is an assistant professor of education.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
